Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, and comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: Nakara
Reviews.Content: We booked through "Expedia Unpublished Rate" and got a great deal over Easter weekend. We checked in to room 505, a large corner unit with a comfy king-size bed and a huge bathroom. The decoration was definitely outdated but the hotel had its charm. Staff were friendly and helpful. The location was superb, perfect for those who love to shop. Wifi was free but parking was $20/day (valet only).

Reviews.Title: “Good, bad, ugly....”
Reviews.Author: KelinSaratoga
Reviews.Content: Good: large room (404), large bathroom, great water pressure, appeared clean, convenient location, pet friendly, polite and friendly staff. Bad: room smelled awful, like a mix of old smoke and whatever was used to cover it up. Ugly: old furniture, institutional concrete balcony that overlooked a parking lot, had to step over drop cloths, painting and construction items in the fourth floor hallway when checking in. I stay regularly in Montreal; up to now it has been at the Hilton Garden Inn or The Delta. I decided to stay closer to the apartment of the people I was visiting this time. The price was comparable to HGI, but the place is beat. It wasn't "ooh, run away" nasty, but it wasn't what I expected for the price. I thought the bed was comfortable, but my traveling companion reported too hard. The location to restaurants and night life was great, but I eat at 7 and go to bed by 11, so not a personal draw. The lobby of the hotel is charmingly old fashioned, but with a casino air about it - not sophisticated at all, more like party central, which is great if that's what you want. The smell of the room was the number one worst thing. It actually made me ill. I woke up at 3AM with a sore throat as a result. The halls get noisy around 3 when the bars close, but the noise from below is not any worse than any other city hotel. The staff was very polite and friendly, but I won't go back unless I hear that the obviously in progress renovation has replaced the smelly furniture, carpet, and wall paper, cleaned the ventilation system, and will result in truly non-smoking rooms/floors.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: A_Dark_Canuck
Reviews.Content: great experience staying here-friendly staff, nice rooms, nice view of the city and a perfect location downtown

Reviews.Title: “our new place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: EdVT
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in town for Cirque du Soleil and the Habs-Sens game March 22nd and 23rd. In the past we have stayed at the Marriott and Le Crystal, among a few other hotels. The service at de la Montagne was superior in every way. Our concierge, Daniel, was very helpful in pointing us in the right direction. We told him what we wanted and he delivered, including 2 for 1 happy hour at Thursday's bar in the hotel. The AC was broke and we alerted the front desk the next morning. That afternoon there was a new AC unit in our room - installed while we were touring old Montreal. As is typical in Montreal, it wasn't cheap to stay here, but we did take advantage of one of their special offers, which cut the price almost in half. I think we found a new place to crash after Habs games.

Reviews.Title: “Location is superb and WIFI is included”
Reviews.Author: FoodieFood39
Reviews.Content: Walk out to the major shopping on st Catherine and clubs/restaurants On crescent street. Great location and hotel is going through a renovation as rooms are a blend of the classic Montreal meats modern hip. Great service

Reviews.Title: “Hockey weekend”
Reviews.Author: royalron31
Reviews.Content: My wife and I flew in on Friday for a weekend hockey game between Toronto and Montreal.Selected this hotel off hotels.com at a reasonable rate.Staff was cordial and helpful.Room was nice and large and comfortable.Large bathroom as well.Night stands,bureau and table need some updating but other than that,it was a great spot to stay. Mind you,to get ice,you have to order from room service and it costs $2.00 or $2.50 (c'mon,it's just ice).10 minute walk to the Bell Centre and an even shorter jaunt to restaurants and shopping.You are almost in the middle of downtown Montreal so lots of activity within a stones throw.About 20 minutes from the airport.They have a couple of restaurants within the hotel but we never ate there.Plus there is a lively Friday night after work crowd in the lounge.We would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Get the Contemporary Room”
Reviews.Author: TheCapo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a contemporary room and it was definitely worth the extra. The room was virtually brand new with modern styling. The location of this hotel is also a huge benefit, St. Catherines less than a minute away, backs on to Crescent, the Bell Centre a 5 minute walk, Old Montreal and St Laurent close by. The rooftop bar and pool area are really nice in the summer too. Will definitely stay here again. Has a different feel than the other major chain hotels in the area, which is a nice thing!

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything... I mean everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alined57
Reviews.Content: We were there this past weekend (Feb. 17/12) for the weekend. This location does not get any better if you go there for shopping (right at the corner), drinking in the hotel, and restaurants in the hotel. It's not meant to go and enjoy a quiet evening with your spouse. This place moves all the time. That's why we like it. There's a bar right there in the lobby, and a few restaurants. They move all the time. Staff was very friendly... right from the reception, to the doorman, to the valet parking. Room was extremely clean and large. We are smoker and did NOT smell anything in the hallway or in the room. We had a balcony, which means you can air it out as well. We will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & old hotel charm at a discount.”
Reviews.Author: FNKYCHKN
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a surprising find thru Hotwire. It is advertised as a 4 star, which it deserves for level of service and amenities. However, if I would not have paid full price.I would choose a more modern and updated hotel for the$200/night. We paid half that, which made it only $20 more than the cheapest hotels which mentioned bed bugs. We figured that it is better to spend a bit extra, and boy, a little extra cash brings you to a much ritzier class of hotel. Keep in mind though, that on top of that they charge $20/day for parking. It is not the cheapest way to stay in Montreal- but it also is nice that it didn't feel like a cheap hotel. It has a nice old school charm about it and location is fantastic! Right by Apple store, Urban Outfitters and higher class shops off of St. Catherine street. Also a great cafe right beside it. Get this hotel on a discount and it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBove
Reviews.Content: This is our second December (22 -24th) visiting this hotel, with its perfect location, wonderful staff and service. The Hotel is cozy and personal, with large comfortable rooms, a lively bar-restaurant, excellent bistro and the kindest breakfast staff. Makes for a nice change as far as hotels go during the holiday season as this hotel maintains a very warm and welcoming atmosphere as opposed the usual impersonal large hotel chains. Also their rates are very attractive despite the high season. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fine food and good location!”
Reviews.Author: pal L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my son over the Holidaze. Great location. The Sunday Brunch is excellent! Super kind staff. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: MICRASTERIAS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Hotel de la Montagne in downtown Montreal in December and were certainly not disappointed. The rooms were very spacious, clean and had lovely antique furniture. The bed was wonderfully firm and had a light and lofty duvet. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast at the luxurious hotel restaurant, Le Lutetia. Service was very good. We were fortunate to take advantage of the amazing Christmas special package, which means your year of birth determines your room rate. For example, if you were born in 1950, your room rate will be only $50.00 per night, from December 11th 2011 until January 15th 2012*. Great promotion! We will be back next time we visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Marble Marvel”
Reviews.Author: AlanaPot
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by this hotel's outward appearance, inside is very beautifully appointed in the lobby and rooms. Beautiful antique furniture in good condition, and marble double bathrooms lend a handcrafted feel to this hotel that is very appealing and luxurious. The view over the city and parts of Mont Real are lovely. The concierge gave us a first rate overview of the city and a warm welcome. Meals ordered as room service were indeed excellent, and I certainly recommend having dinner at least one night in the hotel's signature restaurant as the menu is mouthwatering and the quality excellent. Further service at the door etc was sadly pedestrian. I will certainly stay here again, however their full price is a bit ostentatious.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious room; TERRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: liveeatdrinktravel
Reviews.Content: We were given room 403, and after dumping our bags, we left for the rest of the day to explore the city. When we returned back to our room in the evening, we had settled in for the night when very loud club music (I'm talking thumping bass) started to vibrate through our room. Where was this music coming from? There was a holiday party going in RIGHT UNDERNEATH our room. Literally, we could see the party below us from our balcony. Why would anyone be checked into this room when the hotel knew there was a party that night? When we called the front desk, the snotty person (I'm sorry to say this, but that's the best description I can offer) at the front desk offered us another room, or as compensation, told us the party would be over at 1:30AM (so no big deal, apparently!) We had already unpacked, were in our pjs, so we didn't want to move. But, as if on cue, the dj must have turned the volume UP as soon as we hung up with the front desk. Nope, there was no way we would be able to sleep through that noise, so we went downstairs, got the room key for another room on the 10th floor, and re-packed all our stuff, and trudged upstairs. As compensation, the front desk offered free breakfast. Are you kidding? I asked to speak to the manager, but she wasn't on call for the evening, however, the snotty front desk person (yes, the same girl) offered to leave a note for her manager. Ok. Next day, I went to the front desk to inquire as to what the manager's resolution to this would be. Same snotty front desk girl told me that the manager wasn't in, and that I should speak to her this morning, and that she would be here by 9AM (when I told her I'd be checking out.) Low and behold, when checking out this morning, the manager isn't there. So I left my phone #, and was assured I would be contacted by Tina --, the manager, once she got to work. By 5PM, I hadnâ€™t heard back, so I called the hotel and left another message. Tina called shortly after, and asked me how she could help me, as if she had no idea why I was calling. After she explained to me that the reason why the hotel put us in a room on the fourth floor was because we changed our reservation and requested two beds vs. the single king we had been assigned. Her explanation was essentially to blame us. She actually asked me what I wanted as compensation! Then, she proceeded to explain that since we had not been charged for the second bed (which we were not advised of until that moment), really, what else was I expecting? I found her attitude unhelpful, unapologetic, and frankly, gave me no reason to ever want to return to this hotel. I would NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would go back any time!”
Reviews.Author: Kaitlyn S
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, big room sizes, fun rooftop club, awesome bathrooms!

Reviews.Title: “Do. Not. Stay. Here.”
Reviews.Author: janeKanata
Reviews.Content: Completely unprofessional front desk and concierge. Received the worst service I have ever received in my 40 years of travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Triella
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with spacious rooms which, while older, are very function, clean and well kept. The lobby is quite nice. Wi-Fi access is available throughout. Located next to Crescent Street commuting to the VIA train station, pubs, night life, shopping, coffee and food could all be sond quite easily and by foot from this location. Friendly and helpful hotel staff topped it all off. The bed (queen size) was super comfortable. The only ready not to give it a 5 is because the rooms were dated.

Reviews.Title: “A true 4 star”
Reviews.Author: wino7
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location as they say. In the heart of Montrealâ€™s shopping and club/pub area. You can walk to anything. Some of the perks I really enjoyed wasâ€¦as a guest of the hotel, you get free entry into â€œThursdayâ€™sâ€� nite club. Which can be accessed from inside the hotel. One of Montrealâ€™s hottest clubs. The lounge in the hotel is classic Paris circa 1920â€™s. Amazing chandeliers. Although I like rooms that are modern chic, the Montange rooms are still nice - in that â€œclassic conservative businessâ€� kind of way. Staff were wonderful. My only complaint was my view. I was looking at the back door of the Sir Winstons Pub. HA!...but my room did have a balconyâ€¦(which made up for the view). I would go back. A true 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and larger than expected rooms.”
Reviews.Author: DairyQueen9139
Reviews.Content: Location right in the middle of downtown near many great restaurants and shopping galore. And a stones throw from the Bell Centre. Rooms were spacious and very new looking with balcony with nice view. Only problems were that you could still hear if sirens went off in the streets even from the 6th floor but only faintly and the room feeling cool despite temperature controls in the room. The staff were all friendly and available throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in the center of it all”
Reviews.Author: slane001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel de la Montagne on a combined business/pleasure trip in November 2011. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the suite and bathroom. The suite was well equipped, with a large king-sized, comfortable bed and even included a mechanical shoe polisher and electric pants press. The hotel itself has an intimate feeling and is extremely well located, close to shopping, entertainment and office areas. I will definitely choose this hotel when staying in Montreal in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, Free Internet, Everything Else-Meh”
Reviews.Author: acnova
Reviews.Content: Ugh. I wish they let me do half circles because this was a three and a half circle hotel, but I rounded up to four. There were good things and not so good things about the Hotel de la Montagne. I'll attempt to synopsize them all in the review. The location is good. It's a block up of Rue St. Catherine, the main shopping street. I also found out when I returned to the hotel on the first evening, that one street over is the main nightlife area for the city, Cresecent Street. It gets very busy on weekend evenings. There's also a bar/restaurant in the lobby called Thursdays that turns into a nightclubby sort of thing at night. It also gets very loud, but I couldn't hear the noise in my room, 809. I booked a queen room with a private balcony for a business trip. The conference I attended was not in the hotel, so I got a good nightly rate that was cheaper than the conference hotel, which was the main reason I booked here. The room was spacious with lots of furniture and a huge balcony. My room had a flat screen tv, but my coworkers who were in similar rooms still had the old vacuum tube tvs in the huge armoires. I guess I would have gloated about my tv to my co-workers, had the remote control worked. The view wasn't great, neither was the temperature controls. The bathroom was large and had a nice heat lamp feature, which I imagine must be used a lot during the winter. The water went off and on in the shower for no reason. So I'd be without water while washing my hair, but it would come on a minute or two later. The property itself was okay, but really dated looking and dark. There was free internet however, which made staying there much more pleasant than I would have otherwise rated it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - good value”
Reviews.Author: occasionalgambler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is not too fancy looking on the outside. The rooms are spacious with great views; the shower and mattress are A+ (generally everything else is seconday in my opinion). They had a very filling breakfast buffet - ours was included as part of our package - booked through tourisme-montreal.org. We got the second night at 50% off via this service and the parking was very reasonable at $20/day. The location is good - close to St. Catherine St., adjacent to Crescent and maybe a 20 minute walk to Old Town. We found the staff to be very responsive and helpful - would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Mareens
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ Hotel de La Montagne for 5 days. From October 13- October 17, 2011. We had an amazing vacation and a wonderful stay. If I can describe this hotel in one word, it would be LOCATION. I can not explain how perfect the location is. Everything is close by. You are at the corner of St Catherine Street and Rude De La Montagne. Everything is right there! The hotel itself is great. The staff at the front desk was extreamly helpful. Every morning we would go down to the lobby and asked them how to get to certain places. They were extreamly helpful! Hotel was clean and very nice. We were on the 17th floor. The balcony is a huge bonus for any smokers you can just go outside from your room in the balcony, no need to go downstairs. I can't wait to come back to MOntreal again and we are 10000% staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cabjr
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and spend quite a few nights in the major chain hotels. I took a chance and stayed at a boutique hotel that was recommended by a friend. The Hotel de la Montagne was a real gem to stay at. I had a large spacious, quiet room, large bathroom, and a balcony with chairs (poor view). The hotel is located close to downtown and surrounded by restaurants and shopping. Internet connectivity was free. I truly enjoyed this spot.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de la Montagne, Montreal”
Reviews.Author: JM-from-Connecticut
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of downtown with restarurants within easy walking. The hotel also has two night clubs, Thursday's is on street level and attracts a good crowd. The second is a pool / bar on the top floor. Depending on the weather the top pool/bar can be alot of fun, too. The rooms are very comfortable. The beds, covers and pillows ensure a good night sleep. The rooms are spacious. It seems most, if not all, rooms have a private balcony. The views are nothing special. The only negitive, on one occasion, the curtains within the room did not block the outside lights from entering the room. For breakfast the hotel has a small American style buffet.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: SCleghorn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel with friends, with family and on business and without a doubt it is my favourite. The service is great, the rooms are large and clean, its close to the Centre Bell, restaurants and clubs and bars. It has a great bar in the hotel and in the warmer weather a fantastic rooftop bar. The bars are popular and busy!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed..Buyer and Bather BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: METHINX
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel half a dozen times in the past with general satisfaction. I booked King Contemporary Room ($180/nt) which I stay in as a rule. Upon arrival I found my room had a shower but no bath (?) and as I have back pain issues aggravated by long travel, I asked to switched to room with a bath so I could soak. I was advised that would cost additional twenty-five dollars, - as if a bathtub was an upgrade! On principle I would not pay extra, and as there is no Duty Manager or Manager on duty Sunday (!?) - the hotel clerk opted to satisfy me by downgrading me to an unrenovated regular room which all have bath and showers. This room is fifty dollars less/night on-line, but they would not rebate any money or credit me for the downgrade. The toilet in the room was weak barely functional and when i enquired as to being moved was told by management that they'd send a maintenance man to dismantle and repair the toilet while i was trying to work but they would not, could not move me to another room, though the hotel was 50% capacity. Upon check out, I had a word with the Manager who was unsympathetic; would not rebate money, not offer discount on future stay or apologize for my inconvenience. Further she blamed me for not having asked about a bathtub before booking the room. When I suggested to the MANAGER my kids often blog my travel experiences, good and bad, and this stay would merit mention, she freaked out, suggested i was threatening her and walked away. SUMMARY: Its a classy hotel but management find it necessary to nickel and dime and condescend to even regular customers. C'est domage. I'm going where my patronage is appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Experience the Vibrancy of Montreal! Stay at This Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_girl888
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Hotel de la Montagne on Friday May 20th and stayed for 3 days. It was the long weekend and the hotel was bustling with people. We were cordially welcomed by Judith at reservations. Words alone cannot express the wonderful stay we had at the hotel. Our room was spacious, clean and the beds were so comfortable we didn't want to leave! Often, having comfortable pillows can be a problem, but not here. We all agreed we had restful sleeps, and that was a consensus of 4 ladies! The staff was cheerful, and always greeted us. Alain helped us with our baggage and provided suggestions on places to eat. Daniel helped us with our baggage when we checked out; he was very delightful. The doorman, please excuse as I forgot his name, helped load the baggage into our vehicle. He too was attentive and friendly. Anna, at reservations helped us with questions and assistance with our room needs. Our experience at the hotel made quite an impression with all of us. The breakfasts and brunch were so delicious and the selection plentiful. The only problem was it was so good that I may have put on a few pounds on! We enjoyed the rooftop bar the first night it opened for the season. It has a fantastic view of the cityscape. It has a great social atmosphere, and the people are friendly. Since the roof top bar is open to the public, hotel staff was able to keep the elevators organized and orderly while handling the volume of people. We all agreed we had a wonderful stay at Hotel de la Montagne and it would be our first place of preference to stay in Montreal. We look forward to returning soon! We had so much fun at the hotel; we missed a few of the places we wanted to see. Oh well, now that is a reason to return! Thanks to all the staff for making this a great vacation for all of us, and especially for making it an amazing time for my sister. Be sure to reserve this hotel in advance, as it fills up, especially on holiday weekends, due to its popularity and ideal central location

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: slash182
Reviews.Content: What an amazing experience. Everything about the Hotel de la Montagne was great. From the moment we entered the hotel we were greated warmly and were taken care of. Location wise, it is in a perfect spot very close to St. Catherine and is a very short drive away from old Montreal. The hotel is very clean and organized. From the main lobby to the individual rooms, everything is clean and neat and full of class. Everyone is also very helpful. We had many questions for the front desk as to locations of places around Montreal and they were very helpful and informative. We also found the concierge to be incredibly knowledgable and helpful. He made a fantastic restaurant suggestion for French cuisine at Europea. We took his word and had a fantastic time there, the best dinner we had the whole time in Montreal. Overall, we had a fantastic time at the Hotel de la Montagne and hope to go back soon :-D

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Docktorone
Reviews.Content: A traditional luxury hotel ( you can imagine yourself in Europe) with large well maintained rooms and a very attractive lobby area. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Location is great. Decent value. Not a place to take school age kids as it is a hot spot for a young crowd, that floods into the top floor open air pool and bar. Everybody else will probably have a lot of fun. Long Happy hour helps the budget. Lighting in bath not adequate for makeup. Don't exchange money at the desk ( 90% ), but overall this is a very good hotel choice and I will probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: willearnest
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few years ago (we've been to Montreal something like 10 times now) and it was our first choice on this trip based on that experience. Our trips generally amount to my wife's desire to find clothing she likes. On the side we enjoy good food at reasonable prices. The room, this time and last, was large and nicely furnished - apparently very recently - in a contemporary style. Monday-Friday there are two-for drinks in the hotel bar (and the wine is decent if not great). There is a restaurant tie in (Thursday's) that can easily be reached from the hotel. You can take it to Crescent street which has a wide variety of restaurants (and nightlife if that's your desire). The hotel is next to Ogilvy's - a Montreal landmark department store. So, with a reasonable room rate, a comfortable room, and access to the things we visit for, it's a hard place to beat. No doubt we'll be back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: nadma
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for one night as we decided at the last minute to sleep over in Montreal after a day of house hunting. It was 11:30pm and we still had not booked a hotel. Since we had dinner on Crescent st, we decided to stop at this hotel, litterally one block from the action, to ask for a room. Only one room was left and we lucked out because it was a very nice one. Standard one queen bed room. Bed was very comfortable, bathroom was all in bianca carrera marble, large and clean. We enjoyed a few drinks at the rooftop bar by the pool. Very nice on a summer night. When you stay here you have free access to the large night club (can't remember the name) that is connected to it on Crescent st. We enjoyed dancing there as well. Valet Parking was $20, which is average in Montreal. Service was great from the parking attendant, to the front desk, bar staff, waiters, doorman, etc. The only bad thing was that our room was noisy as it was directly under the rooftop patio on the 19th floor. But it was not that bad. We could not hear the music but more the dragging of the chairs and tables. So I recommend to avoid the 19th floor rooms if you can. All in all, we enjoyed our stay very much. Can't beat location.

Reviews.Title: “will this work?”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveller2010
Reviews.Content: It seems to be impossible to post negative commentson this hotel, I'm giving another try. When i was there room had just been "redocorated" and smelts awfully. We were allocated one of the best room of this hotel. Bed was comfortable and the style pleasant thought the room was really small. No bathroom door and the access is just next to the head of the bed. We had a terrace, well more of a black hole, not painted and horrible view and VERY dirty. This a 2 stars hotels for European standards. Staff really unhelpfull and VERY rude, no concept of client service or basic civil mannaners. Unfortunately this includes the manager too. After staying at this hotel you will find that Montreal too is unpleasent, is that true? I will not go back to this city again after this unpleasant stay in the worst hotel i have ever set foot in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & good rooms”
Reviews.Author: cyberd
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge and is close to where the action is. The bar in the top is nice and provide a good view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good - great for lovers of nightlife!”
Reviews.Author: Nick069
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the hotel are ok - perhaps a little tired and not overly quiet but it is right in the middle of the nightlife & restaurant area and the hotel itself has great entertainment in the bar at night - one night we had a vocalist and accompanying piano player and the other two nights there were bands playing. We found the staff a little aloof (in a typically french way) but our stay was good. There are only very small lifts to service people heading up to the 20th floor bar (which is obviously very popular) but hotel guests are given priority so that's not a problem. A good place to see and be seen I think. I would say this hotel is a little more about the experience rather than the actual stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely NO complaints”
Reviews.Author: UK-USAUnited
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out everyone was very efficient and very friendly. The concierges on duty went out of their way to be helpful as did the front desk staff. Our room including the bathroom was very nice and large and everything worked the way it is supposed to. The location is ideal for restaurants and bars plus it is only a shortcab ride away from old Montreal. We'll stay here again if we do return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for downtown”
Reviews.Author: commodoredavem
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located in the heart of downtown Montreal, just steps from great restaurants, bars and shopping. There's valet parking right below the hotel, and the hotel service is reasonably good. Our room was large, particularly the bathroom, and we had a balcony overlooking the back lane (but not chairs or table on the balcony). And there's a nice patio on the rooftop where we had a drink and looked out on the city skyline. Our room seemed pretty soundproof as we could not hear any noise. However, the decor looks like it hasn't been updated in 10 or more years, and the pool on the rooftop is open to the public, which means we could never get a place to sit. The rooftop bar also gets very busy at night, which is great if you want to be part of a happening scene, but it can also be annoying if you are waiting for an elevator which is packed with bar goers. The bottom line is that this is a reasonably nice hotel in a great location, and if you can get a good rate, it can be a good value as well. And I love that they include free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for rainy weekend”
Reviews.Author: lacontessa1
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel since it was near my conference hotel, and was one of the less expensive ones offered through an Expedia air-hotel package. First time to get a package since our honeymoon, but It was just a little more expensive than paying for just the airfare alone. The package included airfare on Jazz (Air Canada, gives points on United) and didn't have to pay extra for luggage. All of the staff at our hotel, Hotel de la Montagne, were extremely helpful. One night when we were asking the conceirge for advice on Portuguese restaurant, they pulled out the Portuguese manager for even more expert advice, she not only told us her favorite, but, called ahead and made reservations for us giving her name. The room was nonsmoking, clean and quiet, and huge with king size bed, balcony. If you are horribly allergic to smoke, you should note that there was one of those standing sand canisters for smokers to stub out their cigarettes right at the elevator on our floor. We never saw a cigarette there, but, it made me wonder whether all of the hotel is nonsmoking--worth asking. Bathroom was all tiled with separate shower and bathtub and two sinks. The room had a desk, sofa, easy chair, dining table and two chairs. It feels luxurious to spread out. And we got turndown service with delicious chocolates at night. A very nice touch is that the hotel lends umbrellas for free to hotel desks. The free wifi worked great. The hotel is just a few short blocks from the metro, and the 747 bus stop. Save yourself some money and buy a 1 day, 3 day or week public transportation pass at the international currency exchange office immediately after you exit airport customs and luggage pickup. Downside for us old fogies is that the pool bar was mainly a bar in pm and evening with outside folks coming in--which moved into the lobby bar when raining. The bar/pool area was closed several days because of the rain. Outside guests are allowed in after 11 am. One night, some mischief makers moved pictures on the walls from one floor to another. We had asked for a quiet room in advance so they had situated us far away from the pool bar, but, it is a little disconcerting to think of non-hotel guests roaming the hallways. There is a dress code for the pool bar. We never ate at the hotel since the hotel bar/restaurant area in the lobby seemed awfully dark, we weren't interested in bar food, and the menu prices on display near the elevators seemed pricey. Nearby are Cafe Cora, Cafe Vasco de Gama etc. for breakfast. From the hotel, you can easily walk to shops, Museum of Fine Arts (Soup Soupe nearby for salad, sandwich or soup), good restaurants (highly recommend Kazu), or metro to other good options for dinner (e.g., Au Petit Extra near fireworks, Chez Doval for Portuguese, L'Express) or adventure out (e.g, Jean Talon Market--go hungry and plan to eat there or pick up picnic stuff, recommend nearby Le Petit Alep for Syrian food). Note--meals seem to be less expensive the further away you get from the downtown hotel area.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst 4 stars hotel!! BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: bSu28
Reviews.Content: Make sure you get all of your information right because they will take advantages of you. But maybe if you have, it won't help! First of all, they told me that parking was $15/day and it turns out to be $20. Second, to add a bed was told $50 and it turned out to be $75. Third, don't believe the pictures that you see in it's website; it's all fake. The room that I got is no more than a 3 Star hotel at most. All the furniture is old; the horrific balcony (don't go out there! don't even look at it!!) It's disgusting. Fourth, the service that people said was suppose to be friendly, they are not! No smiles, no greetings, not helpful at all when you ask them questions. It is a REALLY bad experience for a 4 Star hotel and I've tried many in the past. If you expect to have a real 4 Stars hotel, you might want to consider some that you are familiar with. It's not worth the money. Overall I would not EVER stay here again and I will advice all of my friends about this hotel. If you are planning to stay here, THINK TWICE or DON'T THINK AT ALL!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ralphleblan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in room 1608 for 4 days during the Jazz Festival. The hotel location is simply great - Centre of the City and close to all the action including restaurants and the Jazz Festival. The check- in etc were good and we received great service from one of the bellhops called Eric. The room was spacious and clean. Our only complaint was a very noisy AC system. As well, there is a rooftop pool but that is fully occupied by the yong adults from the area.Price for the room was reasonable in view of location and time of year - end of June.

Reviews.Title: “Very Montreal”
Reviews.Author: glowingkate
Reviews.Content: Great service from the desk staff and concierge. Everyone was pleasant and very helpful. The location is perfect as it is just off rue St. Catherine for all the shopping you can handle and close to the Metro to get wherever you want. The room was spacious with a large balcony and the bed was incredibly comfortable and clean. The only strange thing was the toilet and bathtub were in one room and the shower and sink were in another but it's definitely not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: princepollux
Reviews.Content: Friendly, professional service at door and registration. Excellent room service. Very nice room with plenty of space, ditto for bathroom. Speedy wi-fi in room. Very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “A note about the pool...”
Reviews.Author: Bwclark
Reviews.Content: Overall it was great, but be warned the pool/terrace is a hot spot for college age kids. It was packed with locals-not really the relaxing dip my wife and I were hoping for. Service was ok in the room but we couldn't even get a drink at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: jerispeer
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here in May 2011. Had a large room with 2 super-comfortable beds, flat-screen TV, mini-bar, coffeemaker and private balcony. Room also had a huge bathroom with double sinks, lots of counter space, a separate tub and shower and bathrobes and slippers. Hotel has a nice bar with 2-for-1 drinks and a very good restaurant. Downside: coffee is only free first night -after that it's listed at $2.50 on mini-bar menu, however, on checking out, we were charged $4.50 for one packet of coffee - guess because there were 2 of us? Other than the exhorbitant coffee charge (as I see it), we loved the hotel and would definitely stay there again and recommend it if staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: benst
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Montreal, and we intially chose the hotel because of its proximity to the drop off for the Hertz, and also to the ViaRail station (as we had some later trips booked). These requirements were well met and we had the additional bonus of being near a number of a great pubs and restaurants (on Rue Crescent and the surrounding streets). We were also near the Metro station and the shops (Rue St Catherine). The check in was painless with the bellman giving us a useful rundown of the hotel and the surrounds (including the daiky happy hour in the hotel bar - half price beer for 3 hours!!) The rooms were large and older style. Beds were very comfortable. The marble bathroom was massive with separate bathtub and shower cubicle. And free wifi in the room! We ate at one on the hotel restaurants (Les Beaux Jeudis) which was pretty good as well. The hotel was at the pricier end of what we were looking at but it was well worth it. Thanks for a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the center of the action.”
Reviews.Author: Trustingtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very handy to Crescent Street, one of the centres of night life in Montreal and also handy to the Bell Center. The rooms are well equipped with a staff that will go out of its way to keep you happy. Its location is such that you will not have much time to spend in your room but while there you will be able to prepare for work or play with in a walk

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Winterlotus
Reviews.Content: I spent several nights here with my parents, who have been regular guests for the past 30 years, and my children. The service and hospitality are top class, and you can tell that everyone on the staff enjoys working there. The food was excellent, as was the location, just off of St. Catherine. I looked forward to coming back to Hotel de la Montagne every evening after sightseeing, and look forward to staying there again whenever I visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Older but clean”
Reviews.Author: hmathis37
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2:15 and check in is not until 3, but they had us settled in our room in minutes. The Concierge Daniel (I think) was very helpful in his dining suggestions. I was initially worried about being so close to the elevators, but we had no trouble with noise. (Perhaps it was due to our stay during the week and in the off season.) Our room was large and roomy and we used the mini bar fridge for our breakfast items of yogurt and juice. The Wi-Fi was easy to use (*remember to ask the front desk for the password) and we never had any trouble getting on. The carpet looked a bit shabby, but was clean, the tiles in front of the shower were discolored from standing water, but the bathroom sinks (two), toilet and newer metal tub were very clean. The best was the green furniture!!! Not beautiful but not entirely ugly either. We got used to it!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - total rip off!”
Reviews.Author: WFleet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 4 stars - the true rating is maybe 2 stars. Think Vegas bordello in a tired, concrete building and you've got the Hotel de la Montagne. Rooms are dark, carpet is worn out, wallpaper peeling, tile is cracked and mildewed, tired furniture, low ceilings, internet was spotty and unreliable, TV small...you get the picture. When we checked in, I told the manager I was disappointed in the room - he said "that's what you get when you book online". I called the online booking company and they said they wouldn't stand behind the rating or give me help finding a new room or getting a refund. To top it off, my camera was stolen from our room and nobody at the hotel gave a darn or even would talk to me.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Masena43
Reviews.Content: First, when this reservation was booked online, through Orbitz, we were advised that the full amount needed to be paid prior to confirming the reservation. This was not really an issue but was the first time we had encountered this policy for ANY hotel for which we have stayed at. There were no further instructions or any other information given after the reservation was made. When we arrived to check in, we were advised that along with the room being pre-paid, we were told that the hotel also needed to charge an additional $200.00 to the card or take $500.00 cash as a security deposit. This again was the very first time we have encountered anything like this. Over the past 10 years, we have stayed at approx 1500 hotels all around the world and this was definitely a first for us. Upon speaking with the staff who was on duty that night, they stated that this was policy and no way around it. I advised her that I understood that this was policy but there needed to be a way to rectify this issue due to the fact that this was never addressed upon booking. We were then told that since it was booked through Orbitz, they were not in control of what went on there. When we asked if there was a manager on duty, the employee stated no and that we would have to contact her tomorrow if we had any further questions. When we explained the situation to her, which she appeared to no longer understand us or care and further advised us that a refund was not possible. I decided to place the security deposit on my card and we were then given the keys to the room. We were then told that the car would be placed in the parking garage and would be available at anytime. We then retrieved our luggage and other items from the car, without any assistance or even being asked for help, from any staff member of the hotel. We both had several bags in which we had to make several trips to get. The next night, we had dinner reservations and when we asked if we could get our vehicle, we were told to give the ticket to the doorman, which was no where to be found. Finally after several minutes of searching and asking the main desk, he arrived and called down to the parking garage. He got off the phone and advised us that the person there was not answering and appeared to be either on break or simply not around. He was then going to turn around and walk away without any further assistance. When we advised him that we needed out car for reservations, we brought us down to the parking garage where we did find a male subject in the booth. We then got our own vehicle and exited the garage. The entire staff was rude and did not seem to care that we were experiencing such a horrible service here. When we arrived later that night, we parked the car in front of the parking garage door and honked our horn and waited for about 10 minutes. We then walked in, again with no doorman around, and advised them that we were trying to park our car back in the garage. They told us to leave the key and that they would take care of it. Upon checking out, we were advised that our room had been charged $1.25 plus taxes for the LOCAL CALLS that were made, which this was really ob-sured and wrong in itself. NO hotel ever has ever charged for local calls. Once again, this was at no time explained to us and there was no sign or literature to show such would be charged. I had questioned family and friends who live in Montreal and they have never heard of such horrible service/policies and understood why we were upset about the whole thing, which ruined our entire stay in Montreal from beginning to end. Needless to say, this will be the last time that I along with anyone else I know will be staying at your hotel. Which is too bad since it does appear to be a very nice hotel with a great location. Again, with all the times I have been in Montreal, this was the first time I have ever experienced such rude, could care less attitude from any staff, which is crazy since customer service usually is and should be top priority in the hotel industry. Customer service, politeness and proper information was definitely lacking at this hotel and is the reason for such a horrible stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price I paid”
Reviews.Author: notkevin
Reviews.Content: I found a $94.00 rate on Travelzoo for this hotel and it was a great hotel for the price. I notice that their regular rates are well over $200 and I don't think I would pay that. Rooms were ok but when they decided to refinish the wood furniture in a green paint, really not a good idea. Service and location were great and considering it was a big hockey weekend it was very quiet. Will stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - big room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: lainie
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at this hotel. We really liked it. The location is excellent for shopping (on St. Catherine) and dining/clubbing (on Crescent). It is also a cheap cab ride or reasonable walk from the VIA train station. The staff at this hotel are amazing. Everyone from the doorman to reception to bell boy totally went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Very friendly people and fluently bilingual. Our room was great. It was a very big room with a king size bed (which was very comfortable). It had both a table and chairs and a desk with free Wifi. The bathroom was huge and gorgeous. It had 2 sinks, a nice big bathtub AND a separate shower. All done in marble. Very nice! Amenities were provided but we didnâ€™t use them. The room had a balcony but it was too cold for us to use it for anything other than keeping our drinks cold! :) Hotel lobby was really nice and there was a bar down there that was packed on Saturday evening. The only thing that wasnâ€™t great was the hallways. They were a bit dated but how long are you in the hallway for? We would definitely stay here again. Looking forward to checking it out in the summer when their rooftop pool and bar area are open!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for almost everything.”
Reviews.Author: t.ocouple
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our four nights at the hotel. You are steps away from the night life of Crescent St. and the shoping on Rue St. Catharine. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Keep in mind that there will be some noise associated with the busy bars nearby, but the comfy beds should help you sleep. Love the fact all rooms have a balcony - that's not easy to find. You can begin your hike up Mont Royal, as the hotel sits almost at the foot of the hill. Their website says they have tubs in every room. This is not the case. We were in one of the contemporary rooms and there was only a rain shower. All in all a great stay for a couple. No shortage of great restaurants all around.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: doubleohjflo
Reviews.Content: what a great deal we received from Expedia. We never had to wait to get into the elevator since we could bypass the line. Hotel was right downtown which was great. We couldn't hear the rooftop pool like some said (and i'm a ridiculously light sleeper) Staff was help and extremely friendly. We've decided to go back every year. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Sabine773
Reviews.Content: This hotel was advertised as a 4-star hotel which seems quite appropriate. The decor inside the lobby give the hotel an appearance of splendor, and the immense size of the bedroom, as well as the bathroom, makes you feel as if you had just walked into an apartement. The bed was incredebly comfortable. After our first night, on our way to breakfast, we mentioned to the hotel staff that the airconditioner is leaving a puddle on the carpet. The airconditioning unit was replaced by the time we had our breakfast. The hotel has a swimming pool, located on top of the roof of the hotel. The view is great and you could eat and drink there as well. However, when we went to the pool at around 6 pm, there was loud music playing and the place was so crowded that we had nowhere to sit. It seemed like a great party place, with mostly adults who were drinking and enjoying to hang out, but my son felt uncomfortable and so we left. Considering this, I would not recommend this hotel to families with young children (unless you do not care about the pool). Breakfast was great, by the way. It was set up as a buffet with a great variety of items to choose from. Another good thing was the location. The hotel is right downtown, in a quieter side street, with great stores nearby, and excellent restaurants to walk to in the evening for dinner. Once in the hotel at night, we used the free internet connection to skype our family and it always worked well. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Disillusioned08
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly unpleasant experience recently at Hotel de la Montagne. We reserved a room for four nights with two queen sized beds and balcony at a rate of 209 Can Dollars a night plus tax. More than we would usually pay but on the basis of good Tripadvisor reviews and a personal recommendation, we decided to treat ourselves. We arrived at hotel to check in. Receptionist advised with pragmatic indifference that our Mastercard had been declined. We were horrified because we knew we had more than adequate credit. The hotel then demanded from us 700 dollars cash to enable us to be accommodated. We did not have this sum in cash and the amount requested was quickly reduced to 244 dollars - the cost of one nightâ€™s stay - but, we were warned, we could not have the key to the minibar and any other service would have to be paid in cash in advance. We are both in our sixties â€“ were they concerned that we might thrash the room? We were allocated a room on the 19th floor with old fashioned brown and cream striped wallpaper, pictures of hunting scenes, a horribly dated brown swirly patterned carpet all dominated by an enormous gothic cabinet containing a big old fashioned television. Private balcony was truly awful â€“ stained bare concrete walls and cracked blocks. (see photo). Our room was very unlike the attractive modern rooms on hotel website. Spent anxious sleepless night worrying but reassured the following morning following an expensive international call to our bank, that our credit balance was fine and that the difficulty appeared to be with the hotelâ€™s swipe system. We returned to Reception. The card was swiped again and approved!! Absolutely no concern or sympathy from the staff member as to how this might have happened. We expressed disappointment with room and this was greeted with total disinterest. We asked if there might be a room available similar to those on website and brochure.. After checking,, receptionist advised that she could move us but at an additional cost of 40 dollars a night plus tax! It appears that some floors have been renovated and may very well look as good as they do on the website but our experience was quite different. We stayed for four nights â€“ on each day the key card to our room was de-activated and each time we had to return to the reception desk â€“ never once was there an apology. All in all a most disappointing stay. We would most definitely not recommend Hotel de la Montagne.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ReneS26
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel directly rather than through expedia. Expedia booking only gives you the first 6 floors we stayed on the 17th floor. Great view of the city. First impression was not great because the security staff were escorting an unruly person out and he was to say the least vulgar and uncooperative. Next we were assisted by the bellman to the front desk. They all were so courteous and accomodating. Our room was huge, so much space, it was bigger than some apartments I've seen, including my son's. The room was older but in good shape and clean. All in all we were treated very well in the hotel and we were there for a week. I just can't believe how accomodating and helpful everybody was. I totally recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DeputyDawgJax
Reviews.Content: With the package deal we purchased on Orbitz, we got one of the older rooms that have yet to be refurbished. Although the furniture was a bit worn, the room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Staff was pleasant and helpful. On-site restaurant was excellent (dinner) but the breakfast buffet wasn't worth the price. The piano bar and the "Thursday's" club get pretty lively. Perhaps the best feature is the location. Easy walking distance to great shopping, restaurants, attractions. Two metro stops within a few blocks, which can get you all over Montreal cheaply and safely. All in all, this was a great experience that we would gladly repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Ryguy22x
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. Stayed here twice and had a great time. It really has it all. Club, two restaurants, terrace with bar and pool. Rooms are alright, nothing to write home about but comfortable king size beds. Awesome central location. Less than a block to St. Cathrine which has lots of shopping and anything else you might need. Walk through the hotel and you are on Cresant which has clubs, bars and dining. Staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great just OK!”
Reviews.Author: nk416
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year. We wanted to stay in Downtown. The furniture was too old and the elevators were crowded, the bathroom was ok. This place is overly crowded with youngsters. If you want a party hotel this is probably what you are looking for just be careful booking your hotel with the renovated rooms and the non-renovated rooms. The location is def ideal with Crescent St. a block away. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lucky143
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to Montreal this year, I have stayed at other hotels in Montreal.This is my favorite.Service is excellant.Rooms are spacious,and have a balcony,which I enjoy.Location is the best,close to Crescant Street night life.Hotel has a rooftop bar and pool,this is where all the action is,view is beautiful at evening.Thursdays bar is also in this hotel,and a great restaurant.The only drawback is the rooftop pool is open to the public after 11 am,so if traveling with childrean not a good spot for you.I have stayed at Omni and LE Crystal,by far the best location.There is a charge of 18 per day to park, but all hotels charge a fee. There is a parking lot next door to hotel , a few dollars cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jenn2025
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel with comfy beds, large rooms, and good service. The only drawback with the pool on the roof. After 11am this pool is open the general public and it looks like "girls gone wild Canadian edition". You even had to wait in line for the hotel elevator as they were herding up the party people all night long. Other than that this hotel is right around the corner from St.Catherines street and lots of cafes with great food and beverages. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Service was lacking, and the lobby looks...”
Reviews.Author: Regina_calabria
Reviews.Content: Service was lacking, and the lobby looks tacky, but this hotel is great! Right down town near a subway, and beds that I wish I owned. I'll def go back

Reviews.Title: “great location and rooms - but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: gloryglory
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on the long weekend with a group of girlfriends for a girls weekend away. Over all had a good experience our first time with this hotel. We stayed in two "Classic" rooms. Important to note that on websites like expedia, rooms that are Classic are the (unrenovated?) rooms with old school charm (which we loved). No photos of these rooms are available on the actual hotel website. The hotel website only shows their Contemporary rooms (updated, very modern, posh rooms). Positives: Amazing location, steps away from St. Catherines, Crescent St bars just behind the hotel, 5-7 min walk to I think 4 subway stops. Rooms are incredibly large and amazingly clean and beautifully prepared. Bathrooms are extremely clean and spacious and luxurious. Lots of great restaurants in the area as well as major chain-type restaurants also available too. SAQ liquor store just around the corner. Service was very good: the front desk staff were pleasant to us, the concierge showed us the facilities and accompanied us up to the room to show us the amenities etc. Very nice old school good service to the wonderful old school charm of the decor and the hotel. Negatives: Pool on the rooftop is really a rooftop bar open to the public. This is a hotspot for locals. Which unfortunately makes the pool completely inaccessible to guests of the hotel (absolutely no poolside space for reserved for guests only). They reserve the pool between 9am-11am for guests, but after 11am it's a free for all. As well, everytime we used the elevator during our 4 day stay, there are many many non-hotel guests in the lobby, crammed in elevators, trying to get up to the rooftop bar. With your hotel card, you get priority in the line up going up, but coming down from your suite is difficult given all the people already crammed in the elevator coming down from the rooftop. We had to split up our group between 3 elevator rides just to get down. Another small negative: A/C is extremely loud at night. Also loud: we stayed on the 16th floor, facing Crescent, and could hear the bars late into the night (even coming home after we were out late). Most of us were deep sleepers, so it didn't matter too much to us. But if you are a light sleeper, request a room facing the other side. Final negative: while checking out, we saw an interaction between another hotel guest and a staff of the management at the front desk. We were not involved, but to be honest, the interaction frightened us a little. The guest wanted to talk to management about picking up his car from the valet, only to find a door ding/dent in his driver side. When he asked about who to talk to, the staff person basically said it was impossible that it happened while his vehicle was in the care of the premises. And she accused the patron of damaging his own car and then blaming the hotel. Wow! We were all extremely unimpressed by this.... yikes! We were glad we didn't have any problems up until then. Overall, would stay at the hotel again, given a great rate on expedia/hotwire etc. Particularly travelling with friends, shopping etc. Would not recommend to families, couples or people travelling for business.

Reviews.Title: “Close to montreal's main drag for shopping”
Reviews.Author: TimboHertfordshireUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel de Montagne from 30th April 2010 until 7th May 2010. The staff very friendly and helpful and the rooms are big and clean (at least by UK standards). The website for the Hotel suggests a quiet ambience but its position in the centre of town and proximity to powerful air conditioning units on the side of the building means that it is quite a noisy location although that did not bother me. Rue Saint Catherine is the main shopping drag in Montreal and the hotel is also close (5 mins) to the underground shops on St Catherine, Bell Centre, Concordia University and Mount Royal (its also close to the metro). The Hotel has a frendly bar on the bottom floor (great for watching the Ice Hockey) and a club attached. On the downside only the first coffee of the day is covered by the minibar all other drinks need to be paid for (I just bought some tea and coffee and made them in my room). I think a lot of people would like to visit Montreal as a francophone city in North America and it does combine the best of Europe and North America. One can get by without French but for me it was a great place to practice and brush up. Hotel de Montagne is well sited and is about 30mins walk from vieux montreal. I rented a car for the week and to be honest that was a mistake as Montreal is very walkable and apart from a trip across the border to Vermont and some quick trips I didn't need one (but it did mean that I was worried about keeping the parking up too date - $ 15.00/day in the lot next to the hotel). Montreal is easy enough to drive around though and although nervous as a UK car driver I didn't find it too hard. Checkout is at 12.00 (which was a bot of a pain as my flight didn't leave until the evening). No hassles with the bill except that they had though I had used the hotel parking for the week which would have been pricey (luckily I kept my tabs from the parking next door). Thanks to everyone there for a great stay,

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to returning to Hotel de la Montagne”
Reviews.Author: Woodbridge_Dude76
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel de la Montagne several times over the past decade. I have stayed at many different hotels in Montreal over the years, Loews Hotel Vogue, Best Western Europa, Novotel, Sheraton Centre, Hotel DuFort, Quality Inn Downtown, Quality Hotel Downtown, Clarion Suites & Courtyard Marriott Montreal but Hotel de la Montagne continues to be my favourite. For starters, you cannot get a better location. Just steps from St. Catherine Street, and one street over from Crescent Street. Secondly, the rooms are very very spacious, the biggest I have seen in Montreal. The beds are very comfortable, the bathrooms are big and fancy and clean. Also, this is one of the few hotels I have stayed at in Montreal that has a balcony for every room, which is nice. I have stayed at this hotel with both friends and with my wife. So it's an ideal location for a couple's getaway or for a weekend with friends. You don't need to look or travel too far for night life, Hotel de la Montagne brings it to you. The roof-top pool and bar is always bustling with people in the summer, and the hotel lobby is connected to Thursday's bar. Great place to grab a bite to eat or hit the bar scene, always a lot of fun. I haven't been back to Hotel de la Montagne for a couple years now, but my friends and I are all booked for a weekend in May 2010, looking forward to it. Like I said above, I have stayed at many hotels in Montreal, but I always come back to Hotel de la Montagne.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel with poor staff”
Reviews.Author: tardis99
Reviews.Content: While the room was acceptable, the front desk was unable to initially give us a non-smoking room as per our confirmed reservation. When pressed, they "magically" found a non-smoking room and were quite rude to us. The staff at this hotel have a very poor attitude. The door man ignored us(his cigarette was more important), the front desk attitude was almost offensive and the room staff barged into our room with not so much as a knock despite our "do not disturb" sign on the door. The management of this hotel really should address the service issues if they want to succeed at this property. we will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Class at its finest!”
Reviews.Author: Quinn-Rowe
Reviews.Content: My husband had never been to Montreal and chose this hotel on a whim. How pleasantly surprised we were on all levels. From the elegant lobby to the spacious and upscale room, the accommodations were first rate. The room was clean and comfortable, top priorities for us. The staff was tolerant of our lack of French and very helpful. The only downside was below our balcony room was a blower unit that was not attractive and at times noisy. However, the remaining view of both Crescent street and the rest of Montreal was excellent. A special applause goes out to the doormen and Front Desk for great tips on shopping, attractions, and nightlife suggestions. Our biggest regret was leaving but look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrcool76
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute getaway for me & I spent about a Week in this Hotel. The Good Points: - Friendly Service throughout my stay. - Hotel has a few bars and a club 'Built in'. (Check out the 'Thursday Bar' on a Thursday). There is a bar right on the top, you can get some great views of the city. - Fantastic Location, Your pretty much bang in the centre of the City. The Bad Points: - Try and get a room facing the main street, if you get a room behind the hotel you may be kept awake by some loud A/C noise at the rear. (if that makes Sense)? - There's only one lift (elevator) that I knew of. But it can be a bit of a wait in the evenings if the hotel gets busy. - No Gym or Fitness Area Apart from that I would recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: fstrdr
Reviews.Content: While looking for a place to stay in Montreal we booked a 4-star through Hotwire, not knowing where we were going to land, in fact expecting a different hotel. To our surprise, Hotwire booked us here. We checked out the reviews before checking in and we were not sure what to expect. Upon arrival any hesitations about staying here were quickly dispelled. Parking: The hotel has one parking lot adjacent to it. It is cheaper to stay here. If you go directly to the parking lot, the cost was $15 on a Saturday night with hockey in town, other days might be cheaper. We were able to get a spot against the wall of the building and keep our keys, a big plus. Hotel: The doorman greets and opens the door and a small water fountain greets you in the lobby. The small hotel registry area is on the left-hand side. We were a little worried, based on previews reviews we read, that a non-smoking room might cost us extra. We were enterprising enough to contact the hotel ahead of time and ask for a non-smoking room, which was agreeably added to our reservation. While checking in, we also requested a quieter room, as my wife is a light sleeper. The attendant said that may be a little difficult as the hotel is situated downtown, but she did her best. We ended up in room 1506, away from the elevators and overseeing part of downtown. The room is extremely spacious, even with a king-size bed, a writing table with a chair, a table with two lounge chairs facing the window, a chest of drawers, with a flat-screen TV above it, with plenty of room to spare. The bathroom has a separate shower, from the tub, and two sinks. Two guests robes were available for us, after a nice bath, a nice touch. A wonderful stay, and we'll recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: kconnies
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via hotwire.com for 1 night and spent 16 hours at the hotel. We came to see a concert at the Bell Centre. We paid $89 plus taxes and fees for the room. When we arrived, they gave us the worst room possible - smoking (on a smoking floor), beside the service elevator and no view. When we asked about a non-smoking room they told us, it would be an additional $50. I travel more than 70 nights a year for work and I've never been charged more for a non-smoking room let alone 56% more. It was more expensive than booking with the hotel directly. It's your typical bait and switch. Since we were not staying long, we kept our room but I would not stay at this hotel again. I judge a hotel by the way they treat all of their guests. If you want to treat the hotwire clients as second class, don't offer your hotel on hotwire. Okay so here's my review: Valet Parking: We paid $18 for the valet parking. It was excellent. The guys were quick and efficient. If you want a cheaper option, there are 2 lots beside the hotel for $10. Check In - Despite the crappy room - the check-in was fairly quick. Room - The room is large with some good extras like balcony, shoe shine and pant press. It was clean when we arrived. The bed was okay. Not bad but not great. The hotel is in the heart of downtown so not quiet which should be expected. Bathroom - It was big with double sinks and partially renovated. Not high end renovations but did feel clean. The shower was not renovated and it had terrible water pressure. Toiletries were standard - nothing like Aveda etc. Turn Down Service - Useless. They put chocolate on our nightstand but did not make the bed or change towels in the bathroom. It's not really turn down service. Location - Fantastic. Walking distance to everything you need in downtown Montreal. We walked to shopping, bars, restaurants and the Bell Centre.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great example of an old (almost) grande dame that somehow remains incredibly fresh, modern and comfortable. The staff is warm and inviting, rooms vary in style yet are all comfortable and there is just a warmth to the place that is hard to describe. Perfectly located in downtown Montreal and I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Lacked Service.”
Reviews.Author: myvoicecarries
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked the best hotel option we could for a downtown Montreal located hotel through hotwire.com (90 dollars a night for 4 nights). We ended up receiving Hotel de la Montagne (hotwire is a service where you don't see the hotel name when selecting, just the price and star rating). We were booked for a 'standard room with 2 doubles', which the website does not show any pictures of (at least not easy to find ones). I had read other reviews on tripadvisor from individuals mentioning these rooms were low quality, and I really didn't want that for my friends and I. When I got to the front desk to check in I asked if there were any available upgrades, to which the woman behind the counter said 'no' immediately. I was surprised because the weekend my friends and I decided to come (on our college reading week) was before the high school spring break and after the university spring break, so it seemed unlikely that the hotel would be completely booked and unable to upgrade us at some point in four days we would be there. I asked again about the upgrade and the woman said kind of rudely 'well you already have 2 doubles, what do you want?' to which I responded 'yes, a standard room with 2 doubles - is there not something nicer?' she looked and found an upgrade to a contemporary room with 2 doubles for 40 dollars addtional a night. We took it. Sidenote: The hotel lobby was the tackiest lobby I'd ever seen. Incidentals were $400 dollars for the 4 night stay. Parking was 18 dollars + taxes a night for underground (if you drive a car, it's more expensive for an SUV). There were 2 public lots right beside the hotel that offered 8 dollar parking, I wish I had just used that instead. The hotel offers complimentary high-quality WiFi, which I've never had at any other hotel. It was a really nice touch that all 3 of us appreciated. The room was really nice, great lighting set up, flat screen television, private balcony (every hotel room has a balcony) and spacious enough for 3 girls and all their stuff. The bathroom was large with two sinks, a shower, and seperate tub. Sidenote: I'm not sure if this goes beyond the hotel or not - but the shower water is 'hard-water' and coming from a city with much, much softer water - my hair was like straw after my first shower (pack good quality shampoo and conditioner and a spray-conditioner - even with all three of those products my hair was still really dry). My friends also encountered the same problem. There is a mini fridge but it is packed with typical mini bar items, which was annoying since we needed a fridge. The gentleman who brought our bags up to the room told us to keep everything on the balcony, calling it our 'natural fridge'. We did and it kind of worked, but I still would have prefered space in the fridge. Not being able to speak a lick of french wasn't an issue communication-wise for the most part (though hotel staff often seemed annoyed with the fact we didn't know any french), but the turn-down service employees could not understand us at all. At one point in our stay we needed more towels and it took 15 minutes for someone to come up, and when she did she wanted to clean the entire room (it was 2:45pm at this point). We kept asking her to come back later and just leave the towels, but she didn't understand. Eventually a manager type came up to speak with us thinking that there was an issue. But she could barely understand us. We were told turn down ended at 4pm and this was the last time she would be available to clean our room, so they came in and quickly straightened up while we did school work on our laptops. This hotel's main selling point is the location. It is literally situated in the ideal place for 20-somethings. Urban Outfitters, French Connection, Betsey Johnson, Forever 21, and other great stores are merely minutes away. The liquor store (SAQ) is also extremely close as are several mini marts. Of course, the dining experience in Montreal is comparably to none and the restaurants that were around the hotel were all excellent. There are several nightlife choices as well. We realize now that the trip is over that we made one large error - asking the hotel about clubs and bars. If we had just googled the clubs and bars ourselves, we would have found what we were looking for. The hotel staff had no idea what the recommend to us, even after we attempted to explain countless times. Asking the locals was no help either. Oh, and on Sunday's if you are looking to go out - plan ahead. So few bars/clubs stay open on Sunday in the winter season that it was impossible to find some place to go. The hotel also had a hard time recommending places to eat to us - which was a first for me. Most hotels I've stayed at are buzzing with information, but the staff here couldn't have been less helpful. We just ended up wandering around and finding them ourselves (Try Pino or Lacadamie - both delicious and within a minute of the hotel). Hotel de la Montagne offers a club/bar right in the hotel - but the age demographic for both were clearly older than us. 'Th Club' was more funny than fun with the rotating dancefloor and 'Thursdays' was basically a pub which was not my friends and I scene. There is also a piano bar, but we didn't spend any time in there. Bars/Clubs outside of the hotel that we went to included Seven (hip hop/r&b bar), Radio Lounge (very young dance bar), Rouge (older crowd, mix of new and classic music), and on the last night we went to Pang Pang Karaoke Bar and rented a private karaoke room (you must go, it was really cheap and a lot of fun). We never got to go to Ultra, but we wish we had. At some point while we were out on Sunday night, I lost both my debit and credit card and they are for a branch that wasn't easily accessable in Montreal. When I spoke to the hotel staff for assistance, they were all very insensitive to the issue (I was 7 hours away from home with ZERO cash and just needed help - not attitude). My friends and I truly believe we were treated unfairly due to our age (and they often seemed annoyed we didn't speak french) and felt the treatment by the staff was often blatantly rude. We were on vacation, we didn't need to be spoke down to or treated so unfairly by the staff. We were so surprised by this turn of events with the staff too, since most reviews always highlight how helpful the hotel's people were. This hotel staff just did not seem to want us there and that's a terrible way to make paying customers feel.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: TripleDDDNashville
Reviews.Content: This small hotel takes you back in time to another era. It has a small lobby and a mezzanine restaurant decorated in old world style. Our room was larger than expected, with a king bed and balcony overlooking the city. The bath was spacious and DIVIDED into 2 separate areas that made it great. Nice robes provided too. We did not eat in the restaurant but ventured into the bar onne night for a night cap. Pretty busy in there so we just got ice and left. Hotel de la Montagne has a great location for shopping and dining and I would return there on my next visit to montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BritGirl_77
Reviews.Content: We attended an event at the Centre Bell, and were recommended by a friend to stay here. It was lovely - beautiful decor, nice room, great location for eating out, and fantasically close to the Centre Bell. We'll definately stay there if we're in Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lunagoddess77
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal for 4 nights, over New Years with a friend of mine. I was worried that the hotel room would be on the small side but I was pleasantly surprised. The room had 2 large double beds, very comfortable, and had a lot of extra space...a desk, a chaise, etc. The bathroom was huge with a separate shower from the tub. The hotel was in a good location & it was a few blocks from the metro. I did find the walk to the Old City and Chinatown far but it was a good way to see the city. The hotel is connected to Thursday's, a bar which I think serves food. It was OK for one night but after that the music was terrible and the crowd wasn't what we were looking for. The concierge wasn't very helpful. Every time we asked for advice he only pushed for the hotel restaurants and NYE at the hotel. All in all..it was a great hotel and I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Decor, Helpful Staff”
